text.tspan: Welcome to Inkscape! This small tutorial will demonstrate the
basics of using the program. This is a regular Inkscape document
that you can view, edit, or even save.
Drawing shapes
On the left there are a set of tools, the Arrow tool,
the Node tool, the Zoom tool and some shapes.
Choose the star shaped tool. By dragging in the
space below you can create stars.

svg.text: Now choose the Arrow tool. You can move thestar around by dragging it. You can make the starbigger and smaller by dragging the little arrowsaround it.Click again on the star. The arrows have changed.Now you can rotate and slant (shear) the star.Choose the Node tool, below the arrow. Now youcan change the shape of the star.Try the other shapes, the rectangle, ellipse, starand spiral. The node tool does special things toeach of these shapes.

text.tspan: Panning the canvas
There are many ways to pan the document canvas. Try Ctrl+arrow keys
to scroll by keyboard. You can also drag the canvas by the middle mouse
button. Or you can press Ctrl+B to display the scrollbars and use them.
Scroll wheel on your mouse also works for scrolling vertically; press Shift
with the wheel to scroll horizontally.
Zooming in or out
The easiest way to zoom is by pressing - and + (or =) keys. You can also
click the middle mouse button or rotate the wheel with Ctrl. Or you can
click in the zoom entry field (in the bottom left corner of the document
window) and set a precise zoom value. Finally, we also have the Zoom tool
(in the toolbar on left) which allows you to zoom in by dragging around an
area.
